backend/main.mo: Main ICP actor implementing user profile management (name, photo, locale), bonus/vesting logic, and access-controlled endpoints using blob storage and authorization mixins.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing implemented features for the Profile page, including fixes for coins captured display, XP progress bar rendering, canister ID links, and game stats fields.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON map of frontend source file paths to short summaries describing each component's purpose, used as a reference index for the frontend codebase.
frontend/ANDROID_BUILD_GUIDE.md: Step-by-step guide for building and submitting the Quantumoney AR Android AAB to Google Play Store, covering prerequisites, keystore generation, build configuration, and troubleshooting.
frontend/android-build-config.json: Android build configuration specifying package name, SDK versions, signing keystore placeholders, required permissions/features, and Google Play Store metadata for Quantumoney AR.
frontend/android-build.sh: Bash script that checks prerequisites, builds the web app, syncs with Capacitor, and produces either a release AAB or debug APK for the Android platform.
frontend/BUILD_INSTRUCTIONS.md: Brief quick-start guide for building the web application for mobile deployment.
frontend/build-mobile.sh: Bash script that builds the web app, initializes Capacitor platforms, syncs assets, and builds Android (AAB/APK) and/or iOS packages based on platform and build-type arguments.
frontend/build-native-interactive.sh: Interactive menu-driven bash script that checks prerequisites and lets the user choose to build Android AAB/APK, iOS IPA/debug, both platforms, initialize Capacitor, or view documentation.
frontend/build-native-packages.sh: One-command bash script presenting a numbered menu to build Android AAB, Android APK, iOS IPA, iOS debug, or combined release/debug packages, delegating to platform-specific build scripts.
frontend/build-native.sh: Bash script offering a simple menu to build Android AAB, iOS IPA, both platforms, or initialize the Capacitor project with required dependencies and platform targets.
frontend/CAPACITOR_NATIVE_BUILD_GUIDE.md: Comprehensive guide for generating native Android AAB and iOS IPA packages using Capacitor 6+, including prerequisites, step-by-step build instructions, device testing, and store submission.
frontend/CAPACITOR_SETUP.md: Setup guide for initializing Capacitor 6+ in the Quantumoney AR project to convert the PWA into native Android and iOS applications.
frontend/capacitor-init.sh: Bash script that initializes Capacitor 6+ for the Quantumoney AR project by installing dependencies, building the web app, and adding Android/iOS native platforms.
frontend/capacitor-plugins.json: JSON manifest listing all required and optional Capacitor 6 plugins for the app, including their versions, descriptions, and required native permissions.
frontend/capacitor.config.json: Capacitor configuration file defining the app ID, web directory, server settings, plugin options (SplashScreen, StatusBar, Geolocation, etc.), and Android/iOS platform-specific settings.
Documents manual CLI commands and a verification checklist for adding a controller Principal to existing ICP canisters.
frontend/DEPLOYMENT_STATUS.md: Status report confirming Quantumoney AR is ready for native mobile packaging via Capacitor 6+, detailing architecture, build outputs, and compatibility.
frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md: Mobile deployment guide covering PWA configuration, Android deployment via TWA or Capacitor, and Apple App Store submission steps.
frontend/DEVICE_TESTING_REPORT.md: Template for recording device testing results across Android and iOS, covering installation, authentication, camera/AR, GPS, wallet, DAO, and UI functionality.
frontend/EXPORT_INSTRUCTIONS.md: Quick export guide providing the fastest path to generate downloadable Android APK and iOS packages for Quantumoney AR.
frontend/FINAL_BUILD_DELIVERY_REPORT.md: Final delivery report for Quantumoney AR native mobile builds (Android AAB/APK and iOS IPA), listing all build infrastructure components, prerequisites, and execution instructions while noting AI cannot directly run builds.
frontend/index.css: Global CSS file that imports Tailwind directives and defines CSS custom properties for light and dark theme design tokens (colors, borders, sidebar, charts).
frontend/index.html: Main HTML entry point that sets up PWA metadata, links the manifest and icons, loads the React app, and registers a service worker with install prompt handling.
frontend/install-test-devices.sh: Interactive bash script providing a menu to install Android AAB/APK or iOS IPA builds onto real connected devices and run test suites for the Quantumoney AR app.
frontend/install-test.sh: Bash script with a simple menu to test Android AAB (via bundletool), debug APK, or iOS IPA installations on connected devices, including a manual testing checklist.
frontend/IOS_BUILD_GUIDE.md: Concise iOS build guide for submitting Quantumoney AR to the Apple App Store, providing a one-command build entry point for version 200.
frontend/ios-build-config.json: iOS build configuration JSON specifying bundle identifier, version, deployment target, required permissions, App Store metadata, and screenshot size requirements for Quantumoney AR.
frontend/ios-build.sh: Bash script for building the Quantumoney AR iOS IPA on macOS, checking prerequisites (Node, pnpm, Xcode, CocoaPods), building the web app, syncing Capacitor, and guiding release or debug archive creation.
frontend/MOBILE_BUILD_DELIVERY_REPORT.md: Delivery report confirming all Capacitor 6+ build scripts, configuration files, and documentation are ready for generating Google Play Store AAB and App Store IPA packages for Quantumoney AR.
frontend/MOBILE_BUILD_GUIDE.md: Step-by-step guide for generating native Android APK and iOS packages for Quantumoney AR using Capacitor CLI, covering required software prerequisites and project setup.
frontend/MOBILE_EXPORT_DELIVERY.md: Export delivery report detailing all configuration files and build scripts created for Capacitor 6+ native packaging of Quantumoney AR, targeting Android AAB and iOS IPA with a 2–3 day build timeline estimate.
frontend/NATIVE_BUILD_COMPLETE_GUIDE.md: Comprehensive step-by-step guide covering prerequisites, initial setup, Android AAB generation, iOS IPA generation, testing, and App Store/Play Store submission for Quantumoney AR via Capacitor 6+.
frontend/NATIVE_BUILD_COMPLETE.md: Complete guide for generating Android AAB and iOS IPA packages for Quantumoney AR (Build 200), listing required software, environment setup, and expected output file paths.
frontend/NATIVE_BUILD_DELIVERY_FINAL.md: Final delivery report confirming complete readiness of Quantumoney AR's Capacitor 6+ infrastructure for immediate Android AAB and iOS IPA build execution.
frontend/NATIVE_BUILD_DELIVERY_REPORT.md: Detailed delivery report enumerating all native mobile packaging infrastructure components for Quantumoney AR, including Capacitor config, build scripts, data persistence architecture, and store compliance verification.
frontend/NATIVE_BUILD_EXECUTION_REPORT.m: Execution report documenting all infrastructure components for Quantumoney AR's Capacitor 6+ build system, describing each configuration file and build script's purpose, prerequisites, and output locations in detail.
frontend/NATIVE_MOBILE_BUILD_INSTRUCTION: Complete instructions guide for generating Android AAB and iOS IPA from the Quantumoney AR PWA using Capacitor 6+, covering prerequisites, device testing, data persistence, and store submission.
frontend/NATIVE_MOBILE_PACKAGING_GUIDE.m: Packaging guide explaining the hybrid Capacitor 6+ architecture for Quantumoney AR and providing full prerequisites and steps for building Android AAB and iOS IPA for store submission.
frontend/NATIVE_PACKAGING_WORKFLOW.md: Workflow document with tables and checklists covering the full Android AAB and iOS IPA generation process for Quantumoney AR Build 200, including architecture confirmation, software requirements, and timeline estimates.
frontend/public/CNAME: GitHub Pages custom domain configuration file pointing to quantumoney.github.io.
frontend/public/data/qmy_spots.geojson: GeoJSON FeatureCollection defining global QMY token spawn locations (cities like Lisbon, Madrid, Tokyo, etc.) with per-wallet limits and cooldown rules.
frontend/public/docs/index.json: Index manifest for the Quantumoney AR documentation site, listing sections (getting started, gameplay, tokenomics, DAO, technical, mobile) with their URLs and external links.
frontend/public/manifest.json: PWA web app manifest for Quantumoney AR, defining app metadata, icons, display settings, and shortcuts for the AR Camera and Profile sections.
frontend/public/map/index.html: HTML entry point for the Quantumoney AR world map page, loading Leaflet.js and custom map assets with a loading overlay.
frontend/public/map/map.css: CSS styles for the full-viewport Leaflet map, including safe-area insets for iOS, a pulsing user location marker, gold-themed zoom controls, and a loading overlay.
frontend/public/map/map.js: Leaflet map script that renders coin and monster spawn markers from localStorage AR state, supports real-time sync via postMessage, and shows popup details for each spawn point.
frontend/public/service-worker.js: PWA service worker implementing install-time precaching of core assets, cache cleanup on activation, and a network-first fetch strategy with offline fallback to cached responses.
frontend/QUICK_BUILD_INSTRUCTIONS.md: Fast-track checklist and quick-build commands for generating Android AAB and iOS IPA for Quantumoney AR, referencing the full guide for detailed steps.
frontend/QUICK_BUILD_REFERENCE.md: One-page quick reference card listing prerequisites and first-time setup commands for native Android and iOS builds of Quantumoney AR.
frontend/QUICK_START_NATIVE.md: Minimal quick-start guide providing one-command build instructions for generating Android AAB and iOS IPA for Quantumoney AR.
frontend/README_MOBILE_EXPORT.md: Overview README confirming Quantumoney AR is ready for mobile export, listing PWA prerequisites already satisfied and providing a one-command build entry point.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root application component that manages routing between sections via URL path mapping, wraps the app in multiple context providers, and conditionally renders a legal acceptance modal before showing the main UI.
frontend/src/components/BottomNav.tsx: Fixed bottom navigation bar with five icon-based nav items (Home, AR, Map, Profile, Rules) that highlights the active section and calls onNavigate on click.
frontend/src/components/compliance/Visua: A simple alert banner that informs users the screen shows visual-only placeholder data with no real crypto transactions, for app store compliance.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Minimal footer component displaying social share links for WhatsApp, X, Telegram, and Instagram along with a 'By HTgamers' credit line.
frontend/src/components/gameplay/Gamepla: A fixed overlay HUD card displaying real-time gameplay stats: XP, meters walked, nearby spawns count, and optional AR detection status.
frontend/src/components/gameplay/Transpa: A reusable dialog modal supporting 'rules' and 'congratulations' variants with scrollable content, confirm/cancel actions, and an optional share button.
frontend/src/components/gameplay/Univers: A fixed full-screen background component that renders an animated universe GIF at reduced opacity as a non-interactive visual backdrop.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Fixed top header with a hamburger menu, logo, refresh button, and an authenticated user dropdown showing profile navigation and logout options via Internet Identity.
frontend/src/components/LegalModal.tsx: Modal dialog that requires users to grant camera and location permissions and check off terms, privacy, cookies, and age confirmation checkboxes before proceeding into the app.
frontend/src/components/profile/Conceptu: Displays four placeholder token allocation cards (Pre-Sale, Team, Founders, Advisors) with amounts and percentages, clearly labeled as conceptual/visual simulation only.
frontend/src/components/profile/Gameplay: Renders a canvas-based mini-map plotting gameplay history events by latitude/longitude, color-coded by event type, with a grid overlay and location count legend.
frontend/src/components/profile/RecentAc: A transient activity banner that displays the most recent gameplay event (collect, capture, or level-up) with an icon, disappearing after 10 seconds.
frontend/src/components/sections/BetaQAC: A QA checklist component for beta testing that auto-detects status of Terms flow, UI, and technical checks using localStorage and DOM inspection, with manual override support and export/copy/download functionality.
An empty file with no content or exports.
frontend/src/components/sections/Burn.ts: Displays QMY token burn statistics including burn history, supply metrics, and charts, with an admin burn form; requires Internet Identity login to view.
frontend/src/components/sections/CameraA: Provides AR math utilities including bearing calculation between coordinates, angle normalization, and projection of world bearings to screen percentage positions within a configurable FOV.
Renders action buttons (Lock, Unlock, Capture) for the nearest AR spawn item, triggering mutations and gameplay history events with visual FX feedback.
A simple UI component rendering Start/Stop camera toggle buttons for the AR camera view.
The main AR camera page that composes the camera feed, AR overlay, HUD, and action bar, computing the nearest interactable spawn within 50 meters based on geolocation.
Renders AR spawn sprites (coins and monsters) positioned on screen using bearing and heading calculations, showing distance labels and locked/captured states.
Maps spawn type strings to static image asset paths for AR overlay sprite rendering, with a fallback to the unlocked coin sprite.
Returns an angular tolerance value (in degrees) for AR targeting based on the player's XP level, scaling from 10° to 20°.
Custom React hook that filters spawn items to only those within 200 meters and within the player's angular field of view based on GPS position, compass heading, and XP-based tolerance.
Custom React hook that reads device compass heading from the DeviceOrientation API, handling iOS permission requests and webkit-specific compass values with 100ms throttling.
frontend/src/components/sections/ComingS: Placeholder page component displayed for unfinished sections (map/AR), showing a construction icon and a button to navigate back to the HUD.
frontend/src/components/sections/CoverPa: Landing/splash page component displaying the Quantumoney branding, animated background, QMY coin, and an 'Enter Game' button that navigates to the HUD section.
frontend/src/components/sections/DAOStru: DAO governance page with two tabs: a proposals list showing mock voting data with for/against counts, and a simple chat room with mock messages and a message input.
frontend/src/components/sections/Economi: Static informational page describing the Quantum Yield economic model, displaying APY rates, staking pool details, and benefits for holders, stakers, and liquidity providers.
frontend/src/components/sections/GameArc: Static informational page presenting the technical architecture of the AR game across tabbed sections covering system overview, components, data flow, diagrams, and MVP scope.
frontend/src/components/sections/GlobalD: Static informational page showing QMY token distribution data including geographic allocation, pre-sale phases, distribution pools, and vesting schedules, all marked as visual simulations.
frontend/src/components/sections/GlobalS: Displays global game statistics including registered players, QMY token metrics, a daily XP line chart, a QMY distribution pie chart, and a top-10 player leaderboard using mock data.
frontend/src/components/sections/GoldPap: Empty file with no content or exports.
frontend/src/components/sections/GoogleM: Empty file with no content or exports.
frontend/src/components/sections/HomeSpa: Renders an animated canvas-based space background with twinkling stars, wobbling planets with rings and glows, and periodic comets using requestAnimationFrame.
frontend/src/components/sections/HUD.tsx: Main heads-up display component that handles Internet Identity authentication, triggers a welcome bonus modal on first login, and renders the home screen with user stats (XP, locked/unlocked QMY) and navigation options.
frontend/src/components/sections/Introdu: Static informational section presenting the Quantumoney (QMY) project's mission, vision, core values, and competitive differentials using Card components.
frontend/src/components/sections/Invento: Displays a tabbed inventory UI showing mock collected creatures (with rarity styling), consumable items, and achievements; requires Internet Identity authentication to view.
frontend/src/components/sections/Leaflet: Renders a full-screen Leaflet OpenStreetMap via an iframe loaded from /map/index.html, with an authentication gate, loading spinner, and an info overlay card; requires login to access.

A map page component that embeds a Leaflet map in an iframe, syncs real GPS or simulated player location via postMessage, and overlays a gameplay HUD with XP and nearby spawns. Requires authentication to render.
frontend/src/components/sections/legal/H: Renders the 'How It Works' legal/informational page by mapping over sections from legalContent, displaying titles and content in a scrollable dark-themed layout.
frontend/src/components/sections/legal/M: Renders the Mission page using missionContent from legalContent, displaying sectioned text in a scrollable dark-themed layout identical in structure to other legal pages.
frontend/src/components/sections/legal/P: Renders the Privacy Policy page using privacyContent from legalContent, displaying sectioned text or lists in a scrollable dark-themed layout.
frontend/src/components/sections/legal/T: Renders the Terms of Service page using termsContent from legalContent, displaying sectioned text or lists in a scrollable dark-themed layout.
frontend/src/components/sections/MapLibr: Authentication-gated wrapper that renders the StaticWorldMap component, showing an error card if the user is not logged in.
frontend/src/components/sections/MapMund: Renders a full-screen iframe embedding the Leaflet map and syncs AR interaction state (locked coins, captured monsters, spawns) to the iframe via postMessage on load and on localStorage changes.
frontend/src/components/sections/MarketA: Displays a market analysis section with competitor comparison data, market growth bar charts, and key metrics cards for total market, target market, and participation goals.
frontend/src/components/sections/Partner: Renders a partnerships page listing six partner cards with categories and descriptions, alongside a strategy overview with icons for DeFi, infrastructure, and ecosystem collaboration.
frontend/src/components/sections/Profile: User profile page showing XP level, rank, wallet balances, captured monsters, and vesting info, with editable display name and profile photo upload backed by canister mutations.
frontend/src/components/sections/Roadmap: Displays a project roadmap timeline from Q4 2025 through 2027+ with phase cards color-coded by status (completed, current, upcoming) and corresponding icons.
frontend/src/components/sections/RulesTu: Displays a tabbed 'How to Play' tutorial for the Quantumoney AR game, covering basics, QMY coin mechanics, and AR camera usage with icon-accompanied cards.
frontend/src/components/sections/StaticW: Renders a static world map image with overlaid player and spawn markers (coins/monsters), supporting layer toggles, location presets, and simulated location context.
frontend/src/components/sections/SWAP.ts: Empty file with no content or exports.
frontend/src/components/sections/TableOf: Displays a navigable grid of cards linking to the main app sections (AR Camera, World Map, Profile, Rules & Tutorial) via an onNavigate callback.
frontend/src/components/sections/Technic: Shows a technical appendix with tabbed content covering mathematical formulas (staking rewards, burn rate, voting power, dynamic APY), specifications, and security details in Portuguese.
frontend/src/components/sections/Technol: Presents the technology stack in Portuguese using tabs covering ICP blockchain stats, Motoko smart contracts, interoperability, and scalability details.
frontend/src/components/sections/Tokenom: Displays QMY token distribution, release schedule, and burn mechanism using Recharts pie and line charts across three tabs.
frontend/src/components/sections/Vesting: Dedicated vesting dashboard page displaying 700M QMY token unlock schedule with charts (line, pie, bar), a progress tracker, and a table of upcoming unlock events with copyable transaction hashes.
Empty file with no content or exports.
frontend/src/components/SideDrawer.tsx: Slide-in side sheet navigation drawer listing gameplay and informational sections, with a logout button shown when the user is authenticated.
frontend/src/components/TermsModal.tsx: Full-screen terms-of-service modal that requires the user to scroll to the bottom before the Accept button is enabled, storing acceptance state via a termsAcceptance utility.
frontend/src/components/wallet/QmySendRe: UI component for sending and receiving QMY tokens via Login ID using tabbed send/receive forms; currently visual-only with no real token transfers until QMY goes live.
frontend/src/components/WelcomeBonusModa: Modal component that displays a welcome bonus breakdown (100 XP, 100 unlocked QMY, 900 locked QMY) with a 9-month vesting schedule grid, and invalidates relevant React Query caches on close.
frontend/src/content/legalContent.ts: Defines TypeScript interfaces and static content objects (terms, privacy policy, mission, how-it-works) used by the legal section components.
frontend/src/contexts/GameStateContext.t: React context provider that aggregates player state, vesting schedule, and bonus data from the ICP backend actor, exposing XP, QMY balances, captured monsters, locked coins, and a welcome bonus trigger to the component tree.
frontend/src/contexts/GeolocationContext: Provides a React context for managing browser geolocation, including permission state, position tracking via watchPosition, and error handling with user-friendly messages.
frontend/src/contexts/LanguageContext.ts: Provides a React context for i18n supporting English and Portuguese, exposing a translation function and language switcher backed by a static translations record.
frontend/src/contexts/ProximitySettingsC: Provides a React context for storing and persisting the user's proximity radius setting (10 or 20 meters) in localStorage.
frontend/src/contexts/SimulatedLocationC: Provides a React context for a simulated GPS location with preset cities, directional movement, and sessionStorage persistence, used for development/testing without real GPS.
frontend/src/gameplay/audio/useSfx.ts: A React hook that plays short sound effects (collect, spawn, levelup, capture) using the Web Audio API with mute/unmute support.
frontend/src/gameplay/bonus/registration: Calculates a 1000 QMY registration bonus schedule that unlocks 100 initially and 100 more each 30 days over 9 months, given a registration timestamp in nanoseconds.
frontend/src/gameplay/density/buildDensi: Groups geographic spots into a 0.5-degree grid and returns density zones with normalized density values and color-coded RGBA fills for map visualization.
A React component that displays a brief animated overlay (emoji + XP text) for coin-lock, monster-capture, or level-up events, auto-dismissing after 1.5 seconds.
frontend/src/gameplay/history/types.ts: Defines TypeScript types for gameplay history events (coin-collect, creature-capture, level-up, bonus-unlock) and computed player stats.
frontend/src/gameplay/history/useGamepla: A React hook that stores and retrieves up to 100 gameplay history events per user in localStorage, keyed by Internet Identity principal.
frontend/src/gameplay/progression/leveli: Provides XP-based leveling utilities including level calculation, level-up detection, XP progress percentage, and a rank label derived from XP thresholds.
frontend/src/gameplay/spots/spotTaxonomy: Defines the unified spot type system for AR and map rendering, including a taxonomy record mapping each SpotType to its label, color, icon path, XP reward, and description.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React Query hook that creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous ICP backend actor based on the current Internet Identity, invalidating dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useArActions.ts: Provides React Query mutation hooks for AR interactions—locking/unlocking coins and capturing monsters—each calling the backend actor, updating local store state, and showing toast notifications.
frontend/src/hooks/useArInteractions.ts: Thin wrapper hook that exposes coin-locked and monster-captured state from the GameStateContext for use in AR components.
frontend/src/hooks/useBetaQaChecklistOve: Hook for persisting beta QA checklist status overrides (pass/fail/pending with notes) to localStorage, with versioned storage and helpers to set, clear, and reset overrides.
frontend/src/hooks/useGeolocation.ts: Re-exports the geolocation context hook from GeolocationContext as a simple named hook.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements Internet Identity authentication via DFINITY's AuthClient, providing a React context and hook with login/logout, identity persistence, and login status tracking.
frontend/src/hooks/usePlayerState.ts: React Query hook that fetches player state from the canister, syncs locked coins and captured monsters into the local arInteractionsStore, and polls every 30 seconds.
frontend/src/hooks/usePrototypeDetection: Hook that performs lightweight frame-by-frame motion and brightness-variance detection on a video element using a hidden canvas, returning a confidence score and detected boolean.
frontend/src/hooks/useQmySync.ts: Provides React Query hooks for reading QMY/player state from the canister, manually refreshing sync queries, and UI-only send/receive QMY mutations that do not perform real on-chain transfers.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for fetching and mutating backend data including user profile, player state, claim bonus, vesting schedule, and a combined sync query.
frontend/src/hooks/useSpawnList.ts: Fetches the list of spawn items from the actor, falling back to mock data if the actor is unavailable or returns empty results.
frontend/src/hooks/useVisualRewardSimula: Simulates a vesting reward schedule client-side using localStorage to track registration date, calculating unlocked/locked amounts and next unlock date over 9 monthly intervals.
frontend/src/hooks/useWalkingMeters.ts: Tracks cumulative walking distance in meters from GPS coordinates, filtering out jitter (sub-1m moves) and unrealistic speed jumps using a throttled state update.
frontend/src/i18n/locales/en.json: English locale strings for the app covering navigation, camera, map, monsters, and common UI labels.
frontend/src/i18n/locales/pt.json: Portuguese locale strings mirroring the English locale, including additional Plug Wallet-specific translations.
frontend/src/index.css: Global CSS file defining OKLCH-based design tokens (gold/dark theme), Tailwind imports, utility classes for glass cards, gold colors/borders/text, and safe-area support.
frontend/src/lib/arInteractionsStore.ts: localStorage-backed store for caching AR coin lock and monster capture states, with methods to read, write, sync from canister data, and emit cross-component storage events.
frontend/src/lib/haversine.ts: Provides utility functions for geographic distance calculations using the Haversine formula, including distance in meters/kilometers and a radius check.
frontend/src/lib/mockGameplayState.ts: Client-side localStorage cache for player gameplay state (XP, coins, monsters) used as a fallback when the canister is unreachable; syncs from authoritative canister PlayerState.
frontend/src/lib/mockSpawns.ts: Defines hardcoded fallback spawn items (coins and monsters) and a helper to filter spawns within a given radius of a geographic position.
frontend/src/lib/qmyApi.ts: Visual-only fallback API module that caches QMY balance, XP, and history in localStorage; real data comes from the canister and transfers are not processed here.
frontend/src/lib/qmyLocking.ts: Local localStorage-based cache for QMY coin lock records, kept for legacy compatibility; the canister is the authoritative source for lock/unlock operations.
frontend/src/lib/termsAcceptance.ts: Manages Terms of Service acceptance state in localStorage under a single canonical key, with helpers to accept, clear, and migrate from legacy keys.
frontend/src/main.tsx: React application entry point that mounts the app with QueryClient, InternetIdentity, and React Query providers.
frontend/src/utils/conceptualWallet.ts: Generates a deterministic wallet ID from a principal using SHA-256 and provides placeholder transaction data for visual display purposes.
frontend/src/utils/qaChecklistExport.ts: Builds and exports QA checklist reports as JSON, supporting clipboard copy and file download with pass/fail/pending totals.
frontend/src/utils/share.ts: Client-side content sharing helper that uses the Web Share API with clipboard and legacy execCommand fallbacks.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for extracting URL parameters from query strings and hash-based routes, with sessionStorage persistence and hash cleanup helpers.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration for the frontend, extending the default theme with custom OKLCH-based color tokens, gold accent colors, Orbitron/Inter/JetBrains Mono font families, gold glow box shadows, safe-area spacing, and custom keyframe animations. Includes plugins for tailwindcss-animate, @tailwindcss/typography, and @tailwindcss/container-queries.
frontend/TECHNICAL_VERIFICATION_REPORT.m: Technical verification report confirming Quantumoney AR's data persistence architecture (ICP canisters, three-tier storage) is production-ready for Capacitor 6+ native mobile packaging at build version 200.
project_state.json: Tracks the current state of the Quantumoney AR/ICP project at schema version 3, listing the five Carteira A canister IDs, known UI bugs (balance display, XP bar, canister ID truncation), and existing feature fix requests with requirement IDs.
unknown.txt: Portuguese-language design document describing the game's detailed flows (login, collection, governance, transactions), MVP feature set, backend data models (player profiles, game config, governance), and main backend operations for the Quantumoney AR game on ICP.
